str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary, but obsolete omo, for which another prolonged form omoo is used in certain tenses; to swear, i.e. Take oath.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary, but obsolete omo, for which another prolonged form omoo is used in certain tenses; to swear, i.e. Take oath.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From epi and ano; up above, i.e. Over or on.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
